title: The Pirate Metrics Framework
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Pirate Metrics Framework.

hook.text: Dave McClure reduced startup growth to five letters: AARRR. It sounds like a pirate, and it stuck.

buildup.text: Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Revenue, Referral â€” each measures a different stage.

discovery.text: Most startups obsess over acquisition and ignore activation â€” getting users to the first 'aha' moment.

twist.text: Fixing retention often matters more than acquiring new users. A leaky bucket never fills.

climax.text: Twitter found that users who followed 30 people were far more likely to stay. That became their focus.

punchline.text: Measure each stage. Then fix the weakest link.
